roleset.name: bother
roleset.note: DISTURB-V NOTES: Frames file for 'disturb' based on wsj; adjectival 'disturbing' based on BOLT-4,5. Member of VNcls amuse-31.1. (from disturb.01-v)
DISTURBANCE-N NOTES: Based on Thyme and Sharp data. Comparison to disturb.01. Disturb.01 is a member of VN class amuse-31.1. Framed by Katie. (from disturbance.01-n)
DISTURBING-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from disturbing.01-j)

example.name: active
example.text: But the administration's handling of the fetal-tissue transplant issue disturbs many scientists.
example.arg: the administration's handling of the fetal-tissue transplant issue

example.name: normal passive
example.text: [Some analysts]-1 also were disturbed *trace*-1 by a pickup in the growth of business inventories.
example.arg: by a pickup in the growth of business inventories

example.name: passivized subject introduced by weird preposition
example.text: They-1 were disturbed *trace*-1 at what they regarded as Dr. Baltimore's confrontational attitude toward the Dingell committee, which held hearings on a dispute over the lab notebooks of a researcher who had co-authored a scientific paper with Dr. Baltimore.
example.arg: at what they regarded as Dr. Baltimore's confrontational attitude toward the Dingell committee, which held hearings on a dispute over the lab notebooks of a researcher who had co-authored a scientific paper with Dr. Baltimore

example.name: Adjectival rel: disturbing
example.text: As a horticulturalist myself , i find the Australian authorities proposals to be highly disturbing .

example.name: This is on the line of instruement or not, but you can have an instruement co-occur with 'electrical', so this is mnr.
example.text: Atrial fibrillation (AF) is an electrical disturbance of the heart that affects more than 2 million Americans
